title.raw: 《五宗世家》 House of the Five Clans

sentences.zh: 孝景皇帝子凡十三人為王，而母五人，同母者為宗親。

translations.text: Emperor Xiaojing's sons who became kings altogether numbered thirteen, with five mothers—those of the same mother were clan relatives.

sentences.zh: 栗姬子曰榮、德、閼于。

translations.text: Consort Li's sons were Rong, De, and A Yu.

sentences.zh: 程姬子曰餘、非、端。

translations.text: Consort Cheng's sons were Yu, Fei, and Duan.

sentences.zh: 賈夫人子曰彭祖、勝。

translations.text: Lady Jia's sons were Pengzu and Sheng.

sentences.zh: 唐姬子曰發。

translations.text: Consort Tang's son was Fa.

sentences.zh: 王夫人兒姁子曰越、寄、乘、舜。

translations.text: Lady Wang, née Xu's sons were Yue, Ji, Cheng, and Shun.

Emperor Xiaojing's sons who became kings altogether numbered thirteen, with five mothers—those of the same mother were clan relatives. Consort Li's sons were Rong, De, and A Yu. Consort Cheng's sons were Yu, Fei, and Duan. Lady Jia's sons were Pengzu and Sheng. Consort Tang's son was Fa. Lady Wang, née Xu's sons were Yue, Ji, Cheng, and Shun.

sentences.zh: 河閒獻王德，以孝景帝前二年用皇子為河閒王。

translations.text: King Xian of Hejian, De, was made King of Hejian as imperial son in Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign.

sentences.zh: 好儒學，被服造次必於儒者。

translations.text: He loved Confucian learning, in his clothing and hasty actions he always followed Confucian scholars.

sentences.zh: 山東諸儒多從之游。

translations.text: Confucian scholars of Shandong mostly followed him in study.

King Xian of Hejian, De, was made King of Hejian as imperial son in Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign. He loved Confucian learning, in his clothing and hasty actions he always followed Confucian scholars. Confucian scholars of Shandong mostly followed him in study.

sentences.zh: 二十六年卒，子共王不害立。

translations.text: He died in year 26, his son King Gong Bu Hai succeeded.

sentences.zh: 四年卒，子剛王基代立。

translations.text: He died in year 4, his son King Gang Ji succeeded.

sentences.zh: 十二年卒，子頃王授代立。

translations.text: He died in year 12, his son King Qing Shou succeeded.
He died in year 26, his son King Gong Bu Hai succeeded. He died in year 4, his son King Gang Ji succeeded. He died in year 12, his son King Qing Shou succeeded.

sentences.zh: 臨江哀王閼于，以孝景帝前二年用皇子為臨江王。

translations.text: King Ai of Linjiang, A Yu, was made King of Linjiang as imperial son in Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign.

sentences.zh: 三年卒，無後，國除為郡。

translations.text: He died in year 3, no heirs, kingdom abolished to become a commandery.
King Ai of Linjiang, A Yu, was made King of Linjiang as imperial son in Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign. He died in year 3, no heirs, kingdom abolished to become a commandery.

sentences.zh: 臨江閔王榮，以孝景前四年為皇太子，四歲廢，用故太子為臨江王。

translations.text: King Min of Linjiang, Rong, was made crown prince in Emperor Xiaojing's fourth year before his reign, deposed in year 4, made King of Linjiang using the former crown prince.
King Min of Linjiang, Rong, was made crown prince in Emperor Xiaojing's fourth year before his reign, deposed in year 4, made King of Linjiang using the former crown prince.

sentences.zh: 四年，坐侵廟壖垣為宮，上徵榮。

translations.text: In year 4, because he encroached on the temple boundary wall to make palaces, the emperor summoned Rong.

sentences.zh: 榮行，祖於江陵北門。

translations.text: Rong departed, took leave at Jiangling's north gate.

sentences.zh: 既已上車，軸折車廢。

translations.text: Having already boarded the carriage, the axle broke and the carriage was ruined.

sentences.zh: 江陵父老流涕竊言曰：「吾王不反矣！」

translations.text: The elders of Jiangling wept secretly saying: 'Our king will not return!'

sentences.zh: 榮至，詣中尉府簿。

translations.text: Rong arrived, went to the Commandant's office for registration.

sentences.zh: 中尉郅都責訊王，王恐，自殺。

translations.text: Commandant Zhi Du interrogated the king, the king feared, committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 葬藍田。

translations.text: Buried in Lantian.

sentences.zh: 燕數萬銜土置冢上，百姓憐之。

translations.text: Several ten thousand swallows carried earth and placed it on the tomb, the people pitied him.

In year 4, because he encroached on the temple boundary wall to make palaces, the emperor summoned Rong. Rong departed, took leave at Jiangling's north gate. Having already boarded the carriage, the axle broke and the carriage was ruined. The elders of Jiangling wept secretly saying: 'Our king will not return!' Rong arrived, went to the Commandant's office for registration. Commandant Zhi Du interrogated the king, the king feared, committed suicide. Buried in Lantian. Several ten thousand swallows carried earth and placed it on the tomb, the people pitied him.

sentences.zh: 榮最長，死無後，國除，地入于漢，為南郡。

translations.text: Rong was the eldest, died without heirs, kingdom abolished, territory entered Han, became Nanhun commandery.
Rong was the eldest, died without heirs, kingdom abolished, territory entered Han, became Nanhun commandery.

sentences.zh: 右三國本王皆栗姬之子也。

translations.text: The above three kingdoms—the original kings were all Consort Li's sons.
The above three kingdoms—the original kings were all Consort Li's sons.

sentences.zh: 魯共王餘，以孝景前二年用皇子為淮陽王。

translations.text: King Gong of Lu, Yu, was made King of Huaiyang as imperial son in Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign.

sentences.zh: 二年，吳楚反破後，以孝景前三年徙為魯王。

translations.text: In year 2, after Wu and Chu rebellion was defeated, in Emperor Xiaojing's third year before his reign he was transferred to be King of Lu.

sentences.zh: 好治宮室苑囿狗馬。

translations.text: He loved constructing palaces, parks, gardens, dogs, and horses.

sentences.zh: 季年好音，不喜辭辯。

translations.text: In his later years he loved music, did not like literary debate.

sentences.zh: 為人吃。

translations.text: As a person he was gluttonous.

King Gong of Lu, Yu, was made King of Huaiyang as imperial son in Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign. In year 2, after Wu and Chu rebellion was defeated, in Emperor Xiaojing's third year before his reign he was transferred to be King of Lu. He loved constructing palaces, parks, gardens, dogs, and horses. In his later years he loved music, did not like literary debate. As a person he was gluttonous.

sentences.zh: 二十六年卒，子光代為王。

translations.text: He died in year 26, his son Guang succeeded as king.

sentences.zh: 初好音輿馬；

translations.text: Initially he loved music and carriages and horses;

sentences.zh: 晚節嗇，惟恐不足於財。

translations.text: in his later years he was miserly, fearing only insufficiency of wealth.
He died in year 26, his son Guang succeeded as king. Initially he loved music and carriages and horses; in his later years he was miserly, fearing only insufficiency of wealth.

sentences.zh: 江都易王非，以孝景前二年用皇子為汝南王。

translations.text: King Yi of Jiangdu, Fei, was made King of Runan as imperial son in Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign.

sentences.zh: 吳楚反時，非年十五，有材力，上書願擊吳。

translations.text: When Wu and Chu rebelled, Fei at age 15 had talent and strength, submitted a memorial wishing to attack Wu.

sentences.zh: 景帝賜非將軍印，擊吳。

translations.text: Emperor Jing granted Fei the general's seal, attacked Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳已破，二歲，徙為江都王，治吳故國，以軍功賜天子旌旗。

translations.text: Wu already defeated, two years later, transferred to be King of Jiangdu, governing Wu's former kingdom, granted the Son of Heaven's banners and flags for military merit.

sentences.zh: 元光五年，匈奴大入漢為賊，非上書願擊匈奴，上不許。

translations.text: Yuanguang year 5, Xiongnu greatly invaded Han as bandits, Fei submitted memorial wishing to attack Xiongnu, the emperor did not permit.

sentences.zh: 非好氣力，治宮觀，招四方豪桀，驕奢甚。

translations.text: Fei loved martial valor, constructed palaces and towers, recruited heroes and outstanding men from the four directions, extremely arrogant and extravagant.

King Yi of Jiangdu, Fei, was made King of Runan as imperial son in Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign. When Wu and Chu rebelled, Fei at age 15 had talent and strength, submitted a memorial wishing to attack Wu. Emperor Jing granted Fei the general's seal, attacked Wu. Wu already defeated, two years later, transferred to be King of Jiangdu, governing Wu's former kingdom, granted the Son of Heaven's banners and flags for military merit. Yuanguang year 5, Xiongnu greatly invaded Han as bandits, Fei submitted memorial wishing to attack Xiongnu, the emperor did not permit. Fei loved martial valor, constructed palaces and towers, recruited heroes and outstanding men from the four directions, extremely arrogant and extravagant.

sentences.zh: 立二十六年卒，子建立為王。

translations.text: Reigned 26 years died, his son Jian Li succeeded as king.

sentences.zh: 七年自殺。

translations.text: Seven years later committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 淮南、衡山謀反時，建頗聞其謀。

translations.text: When Huainan and Hengshan plotted rebellion, Jian heard much of their plotting.

sentences.zh: 自以為國近淮南，恐一日發，為所并，即陰作兵器，而時佩其父所賜將軍印，載天子旗以出。

translations.text: Considering his kingdom near Huainan, fearing one day they would rise and be annexed by them, he secretly made weapons, and often wore his father-granted general's seal, carried the Son of Heaven's flags when going out.

sentences.zh: 易王死未葬，建有所說易王寵美人淖姬，夜使人迎與姦服舍中。

translations.text: King Yi died not yet buried, Jian was attracted to King Yi's favored beauty Nao Ji, at night sent men to welcome her and have illicit relations in the mourning residence.

sentences.zh: 及淮南事發，治黨與頗及江都王建。

translations.text: When Huainan matters arose, investigating the conspirators included Jian and King Jian of Jiangdu.

sentences.zh: 建恐，因使人多持金錢，事絕其獄。

translations.text: Jian feared, thus sent men carrying much gold and money to settle and end the case.

sentences.zh: 而又信巫祝，使人禱祠妄言。

translations.text: And moreover trusted sorcerers and shamans, had men pray and sacrifice with reckless words.

sentences.zh: 建又盡與其姊弟姦。

translations.text: Jian moreover had illicit relations with all his sisters and younger brothers.

sentences.zh: 事既聞，漢公卿請捕治建。

translations.text: The matters having been heard, Han dukes and ministers requested to arrest and punish Jian.

sentences.zh: 天子不忍，使大臣即訊王。

translations.text: The Son of Heaven could not bear it, sent ministers to interrogate the king on site.

sentences.zh: 王服所犯，遂自殺。

translations.text: The king admitted his crimes, thus committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 國除，地入于漢，為廣陵郡。

translations.text: Kingdom abolished, territory entered Han, became Guangling commandery.

Reigned 26 years died, his son Jian Li succeeded as king. Seven years later committed suicide. When Huainan and Hengshan plotted rebellion, Jian heard much of their plotting. Considering his kingdom near Huainan, fearing one day they would rise and be annexed by them, he secretly made weapons, and often wore his father-granted general's seal, carried the Son of Heaven's flags when going out. King Yi died not yet buried, Jian was attracted to King Yi's favored beauty Nao Ji, at night sent men to welcome her and have illicit relations in the mourning residence. When Huainan matters arose, investigating the conspirators included Jian and King Jian of Jiangdu. Jian feared, thus sent men carrying much gold and money to settle and end the case. And moreover trusted sorcerers and shamans, had men pray and sacrifice with reckless words. Jian moreover had illicit relations with all his sisters and younger brothers. The matters having been heard, Han dukes and ministers requested to arrest and punish Jian. The Son of Heaven could not bear it, sent ministers to interrogate the king on site. The king admitted his crimes, thus committed suicide. Kingdom abolished, territory entered Han, became Guangling commandery.

sentences.zh: 膠西于王端，以孝景前三年吳楚七國反破後，端用皇子為膠西王。

translations.text: King Yu of Jiaoxi, Duan, after Wu and Chu seven kingdoms rebellion was defeated in Emperor Xiaojing's third year before his reign, Duan was made King of Jiaoxi as imperial son.

sentences.zh: 端為人賊戾，又陰痿，一近婦人，病之數月。

translations.text: Duan as a person was treacherous and fierce, moreover had impotence, once approaching a woman, fell ill for several months.

sentences.zh: 而有愛幸少年為郎。

translations.text: And had a favored young man as attendant.

sentences.zh: 為郎者頃之與後宮亂，端禽滅之，及殺其子母。

translations.text: The attendant soon after had illicit relations with the rear palace, Duan captured and exterminated him, and killed his mother and child.

sentences.zh: 數犯上法，漢公卿數請誅端，天子為兄弟之故不忍，而端所為滋甚。

translations.text: Frequently violated imperial law, Han dukes and ministers repeatedly requested to execute Duan, the Son of Heaven for brotherhood's sake could not bear it, yet Duan's actions became increasingly severe.

sentences.zh: 有司再請削其國，去太半。

translations.text: Officials repeatedly requested to cut his kingdom, remove more than half.

sentences.zh: 端心慍，遂為無訾省。

translations.text: Duan's heart resented, thus made limitless expenditures.

sentences.zh: 府庫壞漏盡，腐財物以巨萬計，終不得收徙。

translations.text: The treasury rotted and leaked completely, decayed valuables counted in millions, ultimately could not collect or move them.

sentences.zh: 令吏毋得收租賦。

translations.text: Ordered officials not to collect taxes and levies.

sentences.zh: 端皆去衛，封其宮門，從一門出游。

translations.text: Duan removed all his guards, sealed his palace gates, went out touring from one gate.

sentences.zh: 數變名姓，為布衣，之他郡國。

translations.text: Frequently changed his name and surname, dressed as commoner, went to other commanderies and kingdoms.

King Yu of Jiaoxi, Duan, after Wu and Chu seven kingdoms rebellion was defeated in Emperor Xiaojing's third year before his reign, Duan was made King of Jiaoxi as imperial son. Duan as a person was treacherous and fierce, moreover had impotence, once approaching a woman, fell ill for several months. And had a favored young man as attendant. The attendant soon after had illicit relations with the rear palace, Duan captured and exterminated him, and killed his mother and child. Frequently violated imperial law, Han dukes and ministers repeatedly requested to execute Duan, the Son of Heaven for brotherhood's sake could not bear it, yet Duan's actions became increasingly severe. Officials repeatedly requested to cut his kingdom, remove more than half. Duan's heart resented, thus made limitless expenditures. The treasury rotted and leaked completely, decayed valuables counted in millions, ultimately could not collect or move them. Ordered officials not to collect taxes and levies. Duan removed all his guards, sealed his palace gates, went out touring from one gate. Frequently changed his name and surname, dressed as commoner, went to other commanderies and kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 相、二千石往者，奉漢法以治，端輒求其罪告之，無罪者詐藥殺之。

translations.text: Chancellors and two thousand shi who came, following Han law to govern, Duan would seek their crimes and report them, those without crime he falsely poisoned and killed them.

sentences.zh: 所以設詐究變，彊足以距諫，智足以飾非。

translations.text: His schemes for fraud and thorough changes, strength enough to resist remonstrance, wisdom enough to cover faults.

sentences.zh: 相、二千石從王治，則漢繩以法。

translations.text: Chancellors and two thousand shi following the king to govern, then Han would bind them with law.

sentences.zh: 故膠西小國，而所殺傷二千石甚眾。

translations.text: Therefore Jiaoxi small kingdom, yet those killed and injured among two thousand shi were very many.

Chancellors and two thousand shi who came, following Han law to govern, Duan would seek their crimes and report them, those without crime he falsely poisoned and killed them. His schemes for fraud and thorough changes, strength enough to resist remonstrance, wisdom enough to cover faults. Chancellors and two thousand shi following the king to govern, then Han would bind them with law. Therefore Jiaoxi small kingdom, yet those killed and injured among two thousand shi were very many.

sentences.zh: 立四十七年，卒，竟無男代後，國除，地入于漢，為膠西郡。

translations.text: Reigned 47 years, died, ultimately no male to succeed, kingdom abolished, territory entered Han, became Jiaoxi commandery.
Reigned 47 years, died, ultimately no male to succeed, kingdom abolished, territory entered Han, became Jiaoxi commandery.

sentences.zh: 右三國本王皆程姬之子也。

translations.text: The above three kingdoms—the original kings were all Consort Cheng's sons.
The above three kingdoms—the original kings were all Consort Cheng's sons.

sentences.zh: 趙王彭祖，以孝景前二年用皇子為廣川王。

translations.text: King Pengzu of Zhao, in Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign was made King of Guangchuan as imperial son.

sentences.zh: 趙王遂反破後，彭祖王廣川。

translations.text: After King Sui of Zhao's rebellion was defeated, Pengzu ruled Guangchuan.

sentences.zh: 四年，徙為趙王。

translations.text: In year 4, transferred to be King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 十五年，孝景帝崩。

translations.text: In year 15, Emperor Xiaojing passed away.

sentences.zh: 彭祖為人巧佞卑諂，足恭而心刻深。

translations.text: Pengzu as a person was crafty, flattering, obsequious, outwardly respectful but inwardly deeply harsh.

sentences.zh: 好法律，持詭辯以中人。

translations.text: Loved law, used sophistry to entrap people.

sentences.zh: 彭祖多內寵姬及子孫。

translations.text: Pengzu had many favored consorts and descendants within.

sentences.zh: 相、二千石欲奉漢法以治，則害於王家。

translations.text: Chancellors and two thousand shi wishing to follow Han law to govern, would harm the king's household.

sentences.zh: 是以每相、二千石至，彭祖衣皁布衣，自行迎，除二千石舍，多設疑事以作動之，得二千石失言，中忌諱，輒書之。

translations.text: Therefore whenever chancellors and two thousand shi arrived, Pengzu wore black cloth clothing, personally went to welcome them, cleared the two thousand shi residences, set up many doubtful matters to provoke and move them, obtained two thousand shi speaking wrongly, touching taboos, then recorded it.

sentences.zh: 二千石欲治者，則以此迫劫；

translations.text: When two thousand shi wished to govern, then used this to coerce and threaten them;

sentences.zh: 不聽，乃上書告，及汙以姦利事。

translations.text: if not listened to, then submitted memorials to accuse, and defiled them with illicit profit matters.

sentences.zh: 彭祖立五十餘年，相、二千石無能滿二歲，輒以罪去，大者死，小者刑，以故二千石莫敢治。

translations.text: Pengzu reigned over 50 years, chancellors and two thousand shi none could complete two years, then left with crimes, major ones died, minor ones punished, therefore two thousand shi dared not govern.

sentences.zh: 而趙王擅權，使使即縣為賈人榷會，入多於國經租稅。

translations.text: Yet King Zhao monopolized power, sent envoys to counties to act as merchants monopolizing markets, income more than the kingdom's regular taxes.

sentences.zh: 以是趙王家多金錢，然所賜姬諸子，亦盡之矣。

translations.text: Therefore King Zhao's household had much gold and money, yet what he granted to consorts and various sons also exhausted it.

sentences.zh: 彭祖取笔江都易王寵姬王建所盜與姦淖姬者為姬，甚愛之。

translations.text: Pengzu took the Nao Ji whom King Jian of Jiangdu stole and had illicit relations with as consort, loved her greatly.

King Pengzu of Zhao, in Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign was made King of Guangchuan as imperial son. After King Sui of Zhao's rebellion was defeated, Pengzu ruled Guangchuan. In year 4, transferred to be King of Zhao. In year 15, Emperor Xiaojing passed away. Pengzu as a person was crafty, flattering, obsequious, outwardly respectful but inwardly deeply harsh. Loved law, used sophistry to entrap people. Pengzu had many favored consorts and descendants within. Chancellors and two thousand shi wishing to follow Han law to govern, would harm the king's household. Therefore whenever chancellors and two thousand shi arrived, Pengzu wore black cloth clothing, personally went to welcome them, cleared the two thousand shi residences, set up many doubtful matters to provoke and move them, obtained two thousand shi speaking wrongly, touching taboos, then recorded it. When two thousand shi wished to govern, then used this to coerce and threaten them; if not listened to, then submitted memorials to accuse, and defiled them with illicit profit matters. Pengzu reigned over 50 years, chancellors and two thousand shi none could complete two years, then left with crimes, major ones died, minor ones punished, therefore two thousand shi dared not govern. Yet King Zhao monopolized power, sent envoys to counties to act as merchants monopolizing markets, income more than the kingdom's regular taxes. Therefore King Zhao's household had much gold and money, yet what he granted to consorts and various sons also exhausted it. Pengzu took the Nao Ji whom King Jian of Jiangdu stole and had illicit relations with as consort, loved her greatly.

sentences.zh: 彭祖不好治宮室、禨祥，好為吏事。

translations.text: Pengzu did not like constructing palaces and seeking auspicious omens, liked handling official matters.

sentences.zh: 上書願督國中盜賊。

translations.text: Submitted memorial wishing to supervise bandits and thieves in the kingdom.

sentences.zh: 常夜從走卒行徼邯鄲中。

translations.text: Often at night followed foot soldiers patrolling Handan.

sentences.zh: 諸使過客以彭祖險陂，莫敢留邯鄲。

translations.text: Various envoys and passing guests considering Pengzu dangerous and treacherous, none dared stay in Handan.

Pengzu did not like constructing palaces and seeking auspicious omens, liked handling official matters. Submitted memorial wishing to supervise bandits and thieves in the kingdom. Often at night followed foot soldiers patrolling Handan. Various envoys and passing guests considering Pengzu dangerous and treacherous, none dared stay in Handan.

sentences.zh: 其太子丹與其女及同產姊姦，與其客江充有卻。

translations.text: His crown prince Dan had illicit relations with his daughter and uterine sister, had enmity with his guest Jiang Chong.

sentences.zh: 充告丹，丹以故廢。

translations.text: Chong accused Dan, Dan therefore was deposed.

sentences.zh: 趙更立太子。

translations.text: Zhao changed and established crown prince.

His crown prince Dan had illicit relations with his daughter and uterine sister, had enmity with his guest Jiang Chong. Chong accused Dan, Dan therefore was deposed. Zhao changed and established crown prince.

sentences.zh: 中山靖王勝，以孝景前三年用皇子為中山王。

translations.text: King Jing of Zhongshan, Sheng, in Emperor Xiaojing's third year before his reign was made King of Zhongshan as imperial son.

sentences.zh: 十四年，孝景帝崩。

translations.text: In year 14, Emperor Xiaojing passed away.

sentences.zh: 勝為人樂酒好內，有子枝屬百二十餘人。

translations.text: Sheng as a person loved wine and women, had branch descendants over 120 people.

sentences.zh: 常與兄趙王相非，曰：「兄為王，專代吏治事。

translations.text: Often disputed with his brother King Zhao, saying: 'Elder brother as king exclusively handles administrative matters.

sentences.zh: 王者當日聽音樂聲色。」

translations.text: Kings should daily listen to music and enjoy beauty.'

sentences.zh: 趙王亦非之，曰：「中山王徒日淫，不佐天子拊循百姓，何以稱為藩臣！」

translations.text: King Zhao also disputed him, saying: 'King Zhongshan only daily indulges, does not assist the Son of Heaven in comforting and governing the people, how can he be called a feudal minister!'

King Jing of Zhongshan, Sheng, in Emperor Xiaojing's third year before his reign was made King of Zhongshan as imperial son. In year 14, Emperor Xiaojing passed away. Sheng as a person loved wine and women, had branch descendants over 120 people. Often disputed with his brother King Zhao, saying: 'Elder brother as king exclusively handles administrative matters. Kings should daily listen to music and enjoy beauty.' King Zhao also disputed him, saying: 'King Zhongshan only daily indulges, does not assist the Son of Heaven in comforting and governing the people, how can he be called a feudal minister!'

sentences.zh: 立四十二年卒，子哀王昌立。

translations.text: Reigned 42 years died, his son King Ai Chang succeeded.

sentences.zh: 一年卒，子昆侈代為中山王。

translations.text: One year died, his son Kun Chi succeeded as King of Zhongshan.
Reigned 42 years died, his son King Ai Chang succeeded. One year died, his son Kun Chi succeeded as King of Zhongshan.

sentences.zh: 右二國本王皆賈夫人之子也。

translations.text: The above two kingdoms—the original kings were all Lady Jia's sons.
The above two kingdoms—the original kings were all Lady Jia's sons.

sentences.zh: 長沙定王發，發之母唐姬，故程姬侍者。

translations.text: King Ding of Changsha, Fa, Fa's mother Consort Tang, formerly Consort Cheng's attendant.

sentences.zh: 景帝召程姬，程姬有所辟，不願進，而飾侍者唐兒使夜進。

translations.text: Emperor Jing summoned Consort Cheng, Consort Cheng had some taboo, did not wish to advance, and adorned the attendant Tang Er to advance at night.

sentences.zh: 上醉不知，以為程姬而幸之，遂有身。

translations.text: The emperor was drunk and did not know, considered her Consort Cheng and favored her, thus became pregnant.

sentences.zh: 已乃覺非程姬也。

translations.text: Only then realized she was not Consort Cheng.

sentences.zh: 及生子，因命曰發。

translations.text: When the son was born, thus named him Fa.

sentences.zh: 以孝景前二年用皇子為長沙王。

translations.text: In Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign was made King of Changsha as imperial son.

sentences.zh: 以其母微，無寵，故王卑溼貧國。

translations.text: Because his mother was lowly, without favor, thus ruled a low, damp, poor kingdom.

King Ding of Changsha, Fa, Fa's mother Consort Tang, formerly Consort Cheng's attendant. Emperor Jing summoned Consort Cheng, Consort Cheng had some taboo, did not wish to advance, and adorned the attendant Tang Er to advance at night. The emperor was drunk and did not know, considered her Consort Cheng and favored her, thus became pregnant. Only then realized she was not Consort Cheng. When the son was born, thus named him Fa. In Emperor Xiaojing's second year before his reign was made King of Changsha as imperial son. Because his mother was lowly, without favor, thus ruled a low, damp, poor kingdom.

sentences.zh: 立二十七年卒，子康王庸立。

translations.text: Reigned 27 years died, his son King Kang Yong succeeded.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，卒，子鮒鮈立為長沙王。

translations.text: 28 years, died, his son Fu Wei succeeded as King of Changsha.
Reigned 27 years died, his son King Kang Yong succeeded. 28 years, died, his son Fu Wei succeeded as King of Changsha.

sentences.zh: 右一國本王唐姬之子也。

translations.text: The above one kingdom—the original king was Consort Tang's son.

sentences.zh: 廣川惠王越，以孝景中二年用皇子為廣川王。

translations.text: King Hui of Guangchuan, Yue, in Emperor Xiaojing middle year 2 was made King of Guangchuan as imperial son.
The above one kingdom—the original king was Consort Tang's son. King Hui of Guangchuan, Yue, in Emperor Xiaojing middle year 2 was made King of Guangchuan as imperial son.

sentences.zh: 十二年卒，子齊立為王。

translations.text: 12 years died, his son Qi succeeded as king.

sentences.zh: 齊有幸臣桑距。

translations.text: Qi had favored minister Sang Ju.

sentences.zh: 已而有罪，欲誅距，距亡，王因禽其宗族。

translations.text: Soon after had crime, wished to execute Ju, Ju fled, the king thus captured his clan.

sentences.zh: 距怨王，乃上書告王齊與同產姦。

translations.text: Ju resented the king, thus submitted memorial accusing King Qi of having illicit relations with uterine sister.

sentences.zh: 自是之後，王齊數上書告言漢公卿及幸臣所忠等。

translations.text: From this after, King Qi repeatedly submitted memorials accusing Han dukes and ministers and favored ministers like Suo Zhong and others.

12 years died, his son Qi succeeded as king. Qi had favored minister Sang Ju. Soon after had crime, wished to execute Ju, Ju fled, the king thus captured his clan. Ju resented the king, thus submitted memorial accusing King Qi of having illicit relations with uterine sister. From this after, King Qi repeatedly submitted memorials accusing Han dukes and ministers and favored ministers like Suo Zhong and others.

sentences.zh: 膠東康王寄，以孝景中二年用皇子為膠東王。

translations.text: King Kang of Jiaodong, Ji, in Emperor Xiaojing middle year 2 was made King of Jiaodong as imperial son.

sentences.zh: 二十八年卒。

translations.text: 28 years died.

sentences.zh: 淮南王謀反時，寄微聞其事，私作樓車鏃矢戰守備，候淮南之起。

translations.text: When King Huainan plotted rebellion, Ji slightly heard of the matter, privately made tower chariots, feathered arrows, battle defense preparations, awaited Huainan's rising.

sentences.zh: 及吏治淮南之事，辭出之。

translations.text: When officials investigated Huainan's matters, the confession revealed it.

sentences.zh: 寄於上最親，意傷之，發病而死，不敢置後，於是上（問）［聞］。

translations.text: Ji was closest to the emperor, his intent injured it, fell ill and died, dared not establish heir, thus the emperor heard.

sentences.zh: 寄有長子者名賢，母無寵；

translations.text: Ji had eldest son named Xian, mother without favor;

sentences.zh: 少子名慶，母愛幸，寄常欲立之，為不次，因有過，遂無言。

translations.text: youngest son named Qing, mother loved and favored, Ji often wished to establish him, because improper, moreover had faults, thus spoke no more.

sentences.zh: 上憐之，乃以賢為膠東王奉康王嗣，而封慶於故衡山地，為六安王。

translations.text: The emperor pitied him, thus made Xian King of Jiaodong to continue King Kang's line, and enfeoffed Qing in former Hengshan territory, as King of Liu'an.

King Kang of Jiaodong, Ji, in Emperor Xiaojing middle year 2 was made King of Jiaodong as imperial son. 28 years died. When King Huainan plotted rebellion, Ji slightly heard of the matter, privately made tower chariots, feathered arrows, battle defense preparations, awaited Huainan's rising. When officials investigated Huainan's matters, the confession revealed it. Ji was closest to the emperor, his intent injured it, fell ill and died, dared not establish heir, thus the emperor heard. Ji had eldest son named Xian, mother without favor; youngest son named Qing, mother loved and favored, Ji often wished to establish him, because improper, moreover had faults, thus spoke no more. The emperor pitied him, thus made Xian King of Jiaodong to continue King Kang's line, and enfeoffed Qing in former Hengshan territory, as King of Liu'an.

sentences.zh: 膠東王賢立十四年卒，謚為哀王。

translations.text: King Xian of Jiaodong reigned 14 years died, posthumous title King Ai.

sentences.zh: 子慶為王。

translations.text: His son Qing became king.
King Xian of Jiaodong reigned 14 years died, posthumous title King Ai. His son Qing became king.

sentences.zh: 六安王慶，以元狩二年用膠東康王子為六安王。

translations.text: King Qing of Liu'an, in Yuanshu year 2 was made King of Liu'an using King Kang of Jiaodong's son.
King Qing of Liu'an, in Yuanshu year 2 was made King of Liu'an using King Kang of Jiaodong's son.

sentences.zh: 清河哀王乘，以孝景中三年用皇子為清河王。

translations.text: King Ai of Qinghe, Cheng, in Emperor Xiaojing middle year 3 was made King of Qinghe as imperial son.

sentences.zh: 十二年卒，無後，國除，地入于漢，為清河郡。

translations.text: 12 years died, no heirs, kingdom abolished, territory entered Han, became Qinghe commandery.
King Ai of Qinghe, Cheng, in Emperor Xiaojing middle year 3 was made King of Qinghe as imperial son. 12 years died, no heirs, kingdom abolished, territory entered Han, became Qinghe commandery.

sentences.zh: 常山憲王舜，以孝景中五年用皇子為常山王。

translations.text: King Xian of Changshan, Shun, in Emperor Xiaojing middle year 5 was made King of Changshan as imperial son.

sentences.zh: 舜最親，景帝少子，驕怠多淫，數犯禁，上常寬釋之。

translations.text: Shun was closest, Emperor Jing's youngest son, arrogant and indolent with much lewdness, repeatedly violated prohibitions, the emperor constantly leniently released him.

sentences.zh: 立三十二年卒，太子勃代立為王。

translations.text: Reigned 32 years died, Crown Prince Bo succeeded as king.

King Xian of Changshan, Shun, in Emperor Xiaojing middle year 5 was made King of Changshan as imperial son. Shun was closest, Emperor Jing's youngest son, arrogant and indolent with much lewdness, repeatedly violated prohibitions, the emperor constantly leniently released him. Reigned 32 years died, Crown Prince Bo succeeded as king.

sentences.zh: 初，憲王舜有所不愛姬生長男棁。

translations.text: Initially, King Xian Shun had an unfavored consort who bore eldest son Zhuai.

sentences.zh: 棁以母無寵故，亦不得幸於王。

translations.text: Zhuai because his mother had no favor, also did not obtain favor from the king.

sentences.zh: 王後修生太子勃。

translations.text: Queen Xiu bore Crown Prince Bo.

sentences.zh: 王內多，所幸姬生子平、子商，王后希得幸。

translations.text: The king had many inner consorts, favored consorts bore sons Ping and Shang, Queen rarely obtained favor.

sentences.zh: 及憲王病甚，諸幸姬常侍病，故王后亦以妒媢不常侍病，輒歸舍。

translations.text: When King Xian was gravely ill, various favored consorts constantly attended the illness, thus Queen also because of jealousy did not constantly attend illness, then returned to residence.

sentences.zh: 醫進藥，太子勃不自嘗藥，又不宿留侍病。

translations.text: Physician administered medicine, Crown Prince Bo did not personally taste medicine, moreover did not stay overnight attending illness.

sentences.zh: 及王薨，王后、太子乃至。

translations.text: When the king died, Queen and Crown Prince then arrived.

sentences.zh: 憲王雅不以長子棁為人數，及薨，又不分與財物。

translations.text: King Xian naturally did not count eldest son Zhuai as a person, and when died, moreover did not divide and give him wealth.

sentences.zh: 郎或說太子、王后，令諸子與長子棁共分財物，太子、王后不聽。

translations.text: An attendant advised Crown Prince and Queen to have various sons share wealth with eldest son Zhuai, Crown Prince and Queen did not listen.

sentences.zh: 太子代立，又不收恤棁。

translations.text: Crown Prince succeeded as king, moreover did not receive and relieve Zhuai.

sentences.zh: 棁怨王后、太子。

translations.text: Zhuai resented Queen and Crown Prince.

sentences.zh: 漢使者視憲王喪，棁自言憲王病時，王后、太子不侍，及薨，六日出舍，太子勃私姦，飲酒，博戲，擊筑，與女子載馳，環城過市，入牢視囚。

translations.text: Han envoy inspected King Xian's funeral, Zhuai personally spoke that when King Xian was ill, Queen and Crown Prince did not attend, and when died, six days left residence, Crown Prince Bo privately had illicit relations, drank wine, gambled, struck zhu, with women rode swiftly, circled city passed market, entered prison inspected prisoners.

sentences.zh: 天子遣大行騫驗王后及問王勃，請逮勃所與姦諸證左，王又匿之。

translations.text: The Son of Heaven sent Grand Messenger Qian to verify Queen and interrogate King Bo, requested to arrest Bo's illicit relations various witnesses and accomplices, the king moreover hid them.

sentences.zh: 吏求捕勃大急，使人致擊笞掠，擅出漢所疑囚者。

translations.text: Officials urgently sought to capture Bo, sent people to strike, flog, and plunder, arbitrarily released Han's suspected prisoners.

sentences.zh: 有司請誅憲王後修及王勃。

translations.text: Officials requested to execute King Xian's Queen Xiu and King Bo.

sentences.zh: 上以修素無行，使棁陷之罪，勃無良師傅，不忍誅。

translations.text: The emperor considering Xiu originally had no conduct, made Zhuai frame her with crimes, Bo had no good tutors, could not bear to execute.

sentences.zh: 有司請廢王後修，徙王勃以家屬處房陵，上許之。

translations.text: Officials requested to depose Queen Xiu, relocate King Bo with family to Fangling, the emperor permitted it.

Initially, King Xian Shun had an unfavored consort who bore eldest son Zhuai. Zhuai because his mother had no favor, also did not obtain favor from the king. Queen Xiu bore Crown Prince Bo. The king had many inner consorts, favored consorts bore sons Ping and Shang, Queen rarely obtained favor. When King Xian was gravely ill, various favored consorts constantly attended the illness, thus Queen also because of jealousy did not constantly attend illness, then returned to residence. Physician administered medicine, Crown Prince Bo did not personally taste medicine, moreover did not stay overnight attending illness. When the king died, Queen and Crown Prince then arrived. King Xian naturally did not count eldest son Zhuai as a person, and when died, moreover did not divide and give him wealth. An attendant advised Crown Prince and Queen to have various sons share wealth with eldest son Zhuai, Crown Prince and Queen did not listen. Crown Prince succeeded as king, moreover did not receive and relieve Zhuai. Zhuai resented Queen and Crown Prince. Han envoy inspected King Xian's funeral, Zhuai personally spoke that when King Xian was ill, Queen and Crown Prince did not attend, and when died, six days left residence, Crown Prince Bo privately had illicit relations, drank wine, gambled, struck zhu, with women rode swiftly, circled city passed market, entered prison inspected prisoners. The Son of Heaven sent Grand Messenger Qian to verify Queen and interrogate King Bo, requested to arrest Bo's illicit relations various witnesses and accomplices, the king moreover hid them. Officials urgently sought to capture Bo, sent people to strike, flog, and plunder, arbitrarily released Han's suspected prisoners. Officials requested to execute King Xian's Queen Xiu and King Bo. The emperor considering Xiu originally had no conduct, made Zhuai frame her with crimes, Bo had no good tutors, could not bear to execute. Officials requested to depose Queen Xiu, relocate King Bo with family to Fangling, the emperor permitted it.

sentences.zh: 勃王數月，遷于房陵，國絕。

translations.text: Bo was king several months, moved to Fangling, kingdom abolished.

sentences.zh: 月餘，天子為最親，乃詔有司曰：「常山憲王蚤夭，后妾不和，適孽誣爭，陷于不義以滅國，朕甚閔焉。

translations.text: Over a month, the Son of Heaven because closest, thus commanded officials saying: 'King Xian of Changshan died young, queen and consorts not harmonious, legitimate and illegitimate falsely contended, fell into unrighteousness and extinguished kingdom, I greatly pity it.

sentences.zh: 其封憲王子平三萬戶，為真定王；

translations.text: Enfeoff King Xian's son Ping with 30,000 households, as King of Zhending;

sentences.zh: 封子商三萬戶，為泗水王。」

translations.text: enfeoff son Shang with 30,000 households, as King of Sishui.'

Bo was king several months, moved to Fangling, kingdom abolished. Over a month, the Son of Heaven because closest, thus commanded officials saying: 'King Xian of Changshan died young, queen and consorts not harmonious, legitimate and illegitimate falsely contended, fell into unrighteousness and extinguished kingdom, I greatly pity it. Enfeoff King Xian's son Ping with 30,000 households, as King of Zhending; enfeoff son Shang with 30,000 households, as King of Sishui.'

sentences.zh: 真定王平，元鼎四年用常山憲王子為真定王。

translations.text: King Ping of Zhending, in Yuanding year 4 was made King of Zhending using King Xian of Changshan's son.
King Ping of Zhending, in Yuanding year 4 was made King of Zhending using King Xian of Changshan's son.

sentences.zh: 泗水思王商，以元鼎四年用常山憲王子為泗水王。

translations.text: King Si of Sishui, Shang, in Yuanding year 4 was made King of Sishui using King Xian of Changshan's son.

sentences.zh: 十一年卒，子哀王安世立。

translations.text: Eleven years died, his son King Ai Anshi succeeded.

sentences.zh: 十一年卒，無子。

translations.text: Eleven years died, no son.

sentences.zh: 於是上憐泗水王絕，乃立安世弟賀為泗水王。

translations.text: Thus the emperor pitied Sishui king extinguished, then established Anshi's younger brother He as King of Sishui.

King Si of Sishui, Shang, in Yuanding year 4 was made King of Sishui using King Xian of Changshan's son. Eleven years died, his son King Ai Anshi succeeded. Eleven years died, no son. Thus the emperor pitied Sishui king extinguished, then established Anshi's younger brother He as King of Sishui.

sentences.zh: 右四國本王皆王夫人兒姁子也。

translations.text: The above four kingdoms—the original kings were all Lady Wang née Xu's sons.

sentences.zh: 其後漢益封其支子為六安王、泗水王二國。

translations.text: Afterwards Han moreover enfeoffed their branch sons as King of Liu'an and King of Sishui two kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 凡兒姁子孫，於今為六王。

translations.text: Altogether Xu's descendants, to now are six kings.

The above four kingdoms—the original kings were all Lady Wang née Xu's sons. Afterwards Han moreover enfeoffed their branch sons as King of Liu'an and King of Sishui two kingdoms. Altogether Xu's descendants, to now are six kings.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：高祖時諸侯皆賦，得自除內史以下，漢獨為置丞相，黃金印。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: In Gaozu's time feudal lords all contributed taxes, could appoint their own interior minister and below, Han alone appointed chancellor for them, golden seal.

sentences.zh: 諸侯自除御史、廷尉正、博士，擬於天子。

translations.text: Feudal lords appointed their own censor, Chamberlain for Law Enforcement chief, erudite, comparable to the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 自吳楚反後，五宗王世，漢為置二千石，去「丞相」曰「相」，銀印。

translations.text: After Wu and Chu rebellion, five clans kings generation after generation, Han appointed two thousand shi officials for them, removed 'chancellor' called 'prime minister', silver seal.

sentences.zh: 諸侯獨得食租稅，奪之權。

translations.text: Feudal lords only obtained to eat taxes, stripped their power.

sentences.zh: 其後諸侯貧者或乘牛車也。

translations.text: Afterwards poor feudal lords sometimes rode ox carts.

The Grand Historian says: In Gaozu's time feudal lords all contributed taxes, could appoint their own interior minister and below, Han alone appointed chancellor for them, golden seal. Feudal lords appointed their own censor, Chamberlain for Law Enforcement chief, erudite, comparable to the Son of Heaven. After Wu and Chu rebellion, five clans kings generation after generation, Han appointed two thousand shi officials for them, removed 'chancellor' called 'prime minister', silver seal. Feudal lords only obtained to eat taxes, stripped their power. Afterwards poor feudal lords sometimes rode ox carts.
